data.name: ArgumentIsEmpty
data.value: The string argument '{argumentName}' cannot be empty.

data.name: CircularDependency
data.value: A circular model foreign key dependency was detected: {cycle}.

data.name: InvalidEnumValue
data.value: The value provided for argument '{argumentName}' must be a valid value of enum type '{enumType}'.

data.name: InvalidPropertiesExpression
data.value: The properties expression '{expression}' is not valid. The expression should represent a property access: 't => t.MyProperty'. When specifying multiple properties use an anonymous type: 't => new {{ t.MyProperty1, t.MyProperty2 }}'.

data.name: InvalidPropertyExpression
data.value: The expression '{expression}' is not a valid property expression. The expression should represent a property access: 't => t.MyProperty'.

data.name: MissingConfigurationItem
data.value: A service of type '{serviceType}' has not been configured. Either configure the service explicitly, or ensure one is available from the current IServiceProvider.

data.name: IdentityConflict
data.value: The instance of entity type '{entityType}' cannot be tracked because another instance of this type with the same key is already being tracked. For new entities consider using an IIdentityGenerator to generate unique key values.

data.name: WrongStateManager
data.value: Cannot start tracking StateEntry for entity type '{entityType}' because it was created by a different StateManager instance.

data.name: MultipleStateEntries
data.value: Cannot start tracking StateEntry for entity type '{entityType}' because another StateEntry is already tracking the same entity.

data.name: EntityTypeNotFound
data.value: The entity type '{entityType}' was not found. Ensure that the entity type '{entityType}' has been added to the model.

data.name: PropertyNotFound
data.value: The property '{property}' on entity type '{entityType}' could not be found. Ensure that the property exists and has been included in the model.

data.name: EmptySequence
data.value: Sequence contains no elements.

data.name: MoreThanOneElement
data.value: Sequence contains more than one element.

data.name: MoreThanOneMatch
data.value: Sequence contains more than one matching element.

data.name: NoMatch
data.value: Sequence contains no matching element.

data.name: CollectionArgumentIsEmpty
data.value: The collection argument '{argumentName}' must contain at least one element.

data.name: InconsistentEntityType
data.value: The properties provided for the argument '{argumentName}' are declared on different entity types.

data.name: EntityRequiresKey
data.value: The entity type '{entityType}' requires a key to be defined.

data.name: KeyPropertiesWrongEntity
data.value: The specified key properties are not declared on the entity type '{entityType}'. Ensure key properties are declared on the target entity type.

data.name: ForeignKeyPropertiesWrongEntity
data.value: The specified foreign key properties are not declared on the entity type '{entityType}'. Ensure foreign key properties are declared on the target entity type.

data.name: IQueryableNotAsync
data.value: The source IQueryable doesn't implement IAsyncEnumerable{genericParameter}. Only sources that implement IAsyncEnumerable can be used for Entity Framework asynchronous operations.

data.name: IQueryableProviderNotAsync
data.value: The provider for the source IQueryable doesn't implement IAsyncQueryProvider. Only providers that implement IEntityQueryProvider can be used for Entity Framework asynchronous operations.

data.name: EagerOriginalValuesRequired
data.value: Lazy original value tracking cannot be turned on for entity type '{entityType}'. Entities that do not implement both INotifyPropertyChanging and INotifyPropertyChanged require original values to be stored eagerly in order to correct detect changes made to entities.

data.name: OriginalValueNotTracked
data.value: The original value for property '{property}' of entity type '{entityType}' cannot be accessed because it is not being tracked. To access all original values set 'UseLazyOriginalValues' to false on the entity type.

data.name: MissingBackingField
data.value: The property '{entityType}.{property}' is annotated with backing field '{field}' but that field cannot be found.

data.name: BadBackingFieldType
data.value: The annotated backing field '{field}' of type '{fieldType}' cannot be used for the property '{entityType}.{property}' of type '{propertyType}'. Only backing fields of types that are assignable from the property type can be used.

data.name: NoFieldOrSetter
data.value: No backing field could be discovered for property '{entityType}.{property}' and the property does not have a setter. Either use a backing field name that can be matched by convention, annotate the property with a backing field, or define a property setter.

data.name: NoClrType
data.value: The CLR entity materializer cannot be used for entity type '{entityType}' because it is a shadow-state entity type. Materialization to a CLR type is only possible for entity types that have a corresponding CLR type.

data.name: MultipleDataStoresConfigured
data.value: The data stores {storeNames}are configured. A context can only be configured to use a single data store.

data.name: NoDataStoreConfigured
data.value: No data stores are configured. Configure a data store using OnConfiguring or by creating an EntityConfiguration with a data store configured and passing it to the context.

data.name: NoDataStoreService
data.value: No data stores are available. Ensure that data store services are added inside the call to AddEntityFramework on your ServiceCollection.

data.name: MultipleDataStoresAvailable
data.value: The data stores {storeNames}are available. A context can only be configured to use a single data store. Configure a data store using OnConfiguring or by creating an EntityConfiguration with a data store configured and passing it to the context.

data.name: EntityConfigurationLocked
data.value: Cannot change the EntityConfiguration by calling '{memberName}' because it is locked. Use EntityConfigurationBuilder to create EntityConfigurations.

data.name: MultiplePropertiesMatchedAsKeys
data.value: Multiple potential primary key properties named '{property}' but differing only by case were found on entity type '{entityType}'. Configure the primary key explicitly using the SetKey fluent API.
